Federal regulations
require that all
passengers comply
with any illuminated
sign, printed placard
and/or verbal safety
instructions given
by a crewmember.
Under federal law,
no person may assault,
threaten, intimidate,
or interfere with a
crewmember in the
performance of their
duties aboard an aircraft
under operation.
Federal law permits
penalties for crew
interference to include
substantial fines (up to
$10,000), imprisonment,
or both!

properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by Hawaiian Airlines for the Boeing 767; blue double-sided bi-fold laminated card with illustrations and text demonstrating safety instructions and emergency procedures; information code P/N B60015 Type AA1A, revised 8/04.
